alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin; Loess Plains (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 07 at 9:05PM CDT until April 08 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...The Red Flag Warning for Thursday has expired at 9PM CDT this Evening... .A Red Flag Warning Remains in Effect for Friday From 1pm CDT/NOON MDT until 9 PM CDT/8 PM MDT. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT /NOON MDT/ TO 9 PM CDT /8 PM MDT/ FRIDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST NEBRASKA... ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS EXPIRED FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST NEBRASKA... * Affected Area...In NEZ210...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. In NEZ219...Fire Weather Zone 219 Loess Plains. * Winds...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 13 percent. * Impacts...Weather conditions could become favorable for rapid fire growth and erratic fire behavior. Fires may quickly become out of control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
